name: shabbily
content:
shabbily adverb
(BAD CONDITION)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that looks old and in bad condition because of being used for a long time or not being cared for: shabbily dressed It was a mean, shabbily furnished room, with a bed in it.
More examplesFewer examplesStanding in front of her was a tall, shabbily dressed man who looked as if he hadn't shaved in weeks.She has organized the trip, a journey through India aboard a shabbily elegant train. We met in his shabbily grand wood-panelled room in London.

shabbily adverb
(IN A WAY THAT LOOKS OLD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows signs of age, wear, or lack of care: A shabbily dressed man lay sleeping in the park.
shabbily adverb
(IN AN UNFAIR WAY)
in a way that is unfair or does not show respect: Lawsuits arise when people feel that they were treated shabbily.
